March, 1-3 2021
  • About
  • Tracks

  • Sponsors
2022 Joint OGC OSGeo ASF Code Sprint
Open Software and Standards Code Sprint
Tell Me More Register

About

A Code Sprint is a three day virtual event, where dozens of developers from around the world come together to code and share their ideas. The main goals of this code sprint are to support the development open standards for geospatial informations, and to support the development of free and open source software which implements those standards, as well as creating awareness about the standards and software projects. This code sprint is hosted by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC), The Open Geospatial Foundation (OSGeo) and Apache Software Foundation (ASF).

Privacy Policy
OGC Code Sprints do not log or share your personal information. We don't track you. We don't profile you. Period
